h4.span: Our mission is to promote a nurturing and challenging atmosphere where students will achieve high academic standards and develop essential career skills. We offer full support for English Language Learners,(ELL/ESL) and special education populations. The Preparatory Charter School of Mathematics, Science, Technology and Careers

div.class: efbl_fb_story efbl_ver_free halfwidth added_photos efbl_has_image efbl_

div.p: We understand that there are many questions about returning to the building, graduation, etc. As we develop a plan, we will update you with the new information. Our hearts are broken. We love and miss our Prep Charter family. 💔

div.class: efbl_fb_story efbl_ver_free halfwidth added_video efbl_has_image efbl_

div.p: PLEASE PLEASE PLEASE reschedule prom and graduation for sometime in the summer when this is all over. These kids deserve it! I am happy to help in whatever way I can to make it happen! Thank you and stay safe! <3

div.div: Copyright © 2020 The Preparatory Charter School. All rights reserved.
Education Hub Pro by WEN Themes

h3.span: After implementing our on-line learning program for the past two weeks, we have received constructive feedback from both students and teachers. With this feedback we have decided to modify our attendance procedures. As of March 30th, we have determined that we will extend the amount of time that students are able to sign into advisory for attendance.

Students will now have until noon each day to log onto Google Classroom and complete the attendance question of the day. Please remember, we ARE tracking attendance. Failure to sign in and the accumulation of unexcused distance learning absences (DLA) can still be grounds for a recommendation to summer school for attendance. In addition, distance learning attendance will still be considered for attendance to the prom.
If you have any questions, please do not hesitate to contact us.
The 2020-2021 Prep lottery has been generated. Please click HERE to view the results.
Acceptance letters will be sent to those students whose names are pulled in the lottery and a waitlist letter to students whose names are on the waiting list.

h2.span: Pennsylvania schools will remain closed for the rest of the academic year because of the coronavirus pandemic that has sickened thousands and caused hundreds of deaths statewide, under an order signed Thursday by the state’s education secretary.

The Prep will continue with the Remote Learning Plan that has been in place since schools were closed in March. Following Spring Break, on April 20, remote learning will resume. Students and staff should follow the schedules and routines that are currently in place.

We continue to reach out to students who may be experiencing difficulty with technology-related issues. Any student who is experiencing difficulty because of computer or internet issues should contact their teachers or reach out directly to Mrs. Dembek, our Assistant Principal, and arrangements will be made to alleviate the problem.

The Prep’s Continuation of Education plan, which has been filed with the Philadelphia Department of Education, will be posted on our website. Parents and students are urged to review it and contact us with questions or requests for assistance regarding any issue that may affect their ability to access and/or participate in the instructional program.

Due to the urgency with which we were directed to close school, we are aware that some students may have left personal belongings within the school building, particularly in their lockers. We will make arrangements for students to safely retrieve these belongings as close to the end of the regularly scheduled school year as possible. We will update our students with this information as soon as these arrangements have been solidified.

Summer school will be offered this summer to allow students an opportunity to remediate and obtain credits for any courses that they may have failed during the 2019-2020 school year. Details as to how these courses will be delivered, will be provided as soon as they are available.

We will keep you posted on a date for the graduation ceremony. We are all committed to providing our seniors with an appropriate ceremony to celebrate this important milestone. When it is safe to do so, we look forward to seeing our seniors receive their diplomas in the traditional Prep style. In addition, an email will be sent directly to Senior students addressing additional concerns as they pertain to CCP courses, Prom, the reimbursement of fees and other senior activities.
